content.title: Femoropopliteal Bypass (Above-Knee)
content.definition: Surgical bypass from common femoral artery to above-knee popliteal artery for superficial femoral artery occlusive disease.

concepts.definition: Clinical scenarios warranting above-knee femoropopliteal bypass.

primary: Lifestyle-limiting claudication refractory to exercise therapy and medical management
Critical limb ischemia (rest pain, tissue loss)
clinical_features.anatomy: Patent above-knee popliteal artery with good runoff

concepts.definition: Choice of bypass conduit for femoropopliteal reconstruction.

prosthetic.indications: Inadequate vein, need for rapid revascularization

concepts.definition: Key technical aspects of femoropopliteal bypass construction.

clinical_features.inflow: Common femoral artery via groin incision, endarterectomy if needed
clinical_features.outflow: Above-knee popliteal via medial thigh incision

concepts.definition: Expected outcomes following above-knee femoropopliteal bypass.

clinical_features.anticoagulation: Controversial - aspirin minimum, some add anticoagulation for prosthetic

diagnostic_criteria.graft_stenosis: PSV ratio >3.5 or absolute PSV >300 cm/s

sources.reference: Conte MS et al. J Vasc Surg. 2019;69:3S-125S
